about_the_game:
30% of the donation goes to lord GabeN

30% of it goes to the Pudding organization somewhere in Nosolute

(it's a charity organization that aims to ensure everyone can afford to eat puddings no matter rich or poor.)

40% of it goes to the doujin circle Imaginary Traveller(Mars division)

Steam-chan-sama wishes that there are some actual content(some form of value) that the customer would receive from buying the DLC.

As much as I want to give out the character/world settings and stuff, its much easier to edit and update them in the discord so I don't wanna.

The music are all royalty-free music and don't belong to me so I can't give them either.

So here's the artbook(or whatever its called).

Featuring:

Concept Art - see how the characters evolved during game's development

(there's basically none)

CG Art - see all the CG art used in the game!

(there's also basically none,I have no idea what CG are needed so i didn't commission anything) 

(I am still finishing the script right now)

Art assets - see all the art assets used in the VN part of the game!

(there's actually quite a lot i think)

Access:

After download, you'll find the Artbook in your game's directory folder, accessible through: A2C->Manage->Browse Local Files

(Someone remind me to make the gallery mode which can be accessed for free someday thanks)
detailed_description:
30% of the donation goes to lord GabeN

30% of it goes to the Pudding organization somewhere in Nosolute

(it's a charity organization that aims to ensure everyone can afford to eat puddings no matter rich or poor.)

40% of it goes to the doujin circle Imaginary Traveller(Mars division)

Steam-chan-sama wishes that there are some actual content(some form of value) that the customer would receive from buying the DLC.

As much as I want to give out the character/world settings and stuff, its much easier to edit and update them in the discord so I don't wanna.

The music are all royalty-free music and don't belong to me so I can't give them either.

So here's the artbook(or whatever its called).

Featuring:

Concept Art - see how the characters evolved during game's development

(there's basically none)

CG Art - see all the CG art used in the game!

(there's also basically none,I have no idea what CG are needed so i didn't commission anything) 

(I am still finishing the script right now)

Art assets - see all the art assets used in the VN part of the game!

(there's actually quite a lot i think)

Access:

After download, you'll find the Artbook in your game's directory folder, accessible through: A2C->Manage->Browse Local Files

(Someone remind me to make the gallery mode which can be accessed for free someday thanks)
